text:
-I'd like to invite you all to
come along with me on a journey.
Welcome...

to the Michael Scott
Paper Company.

-We got Vikram.
-You got me.
We we going?

-We have a meeting
with an investor today.
-Yes, we do. So, get excited.

Well, I'm sure that you must all
have very, very busy schedules,

so I appreciate
you meeting with us here today.
What this is is a business

that I have worked toward
my entire life.

Hey.
[ Snapping fingers ]

-You know, Michael,
you want to succeed?

You've got to apply the same --
[ Car door slams ]
[ Toilet flushes ]
-We are in the heart of it.

And the surge of water carries
our business out to the sea.
I have sent out an evite

for our big grand opening
pancake luncheon.
6 yeses, 1 maybe, only 11 nos...
um, and 788 not-yet-replieds,

but of that group,
782 have viewed it.
-Things are a little slow here,

and there's only so much cold
calling you can do in a day.

Turns out there's no limit
to the number of cheese puffs

you can throw at someone's face.
-Hup!
We're getting pretty good at it.

-Michael, I want you to stop
pestering my salesmen,

and I want you to leave
Dunder Mifflin alone.
Do you understand?
-I understand...nothing.

-[ Muffled ] Not much.
What's up with you?

No, it's okay.
I'm in the bathroom.

Hey, you been watching "Damages"
this year?
It's so good.
Now, you know how to tune in.

It's as good as anything on HBO.
[ Urinating ]
Hey, does blue go with tan?

-I am going to come at you, and
I'm going to come at you hard.

I am going to steal
all of your clients,

and then I am going to kill them
in front of you.

-Michael.
-[ Whispering ] Just getting

hardcore with him.
-Finally.

-Dwight.
-Michael.

-I hope you're not recording
this conversation.
Good.

I will see you this weekend
for the Penguins.
Box seats as usual.

-Uh, okay. Sure.
-Good, good. Good.

I will see you.
-Thank you, Mr. Schofield,
for your time.
Much appreciated.
Oh, and tell me, um...
How's your gay son?
-Excuse me?
-I color-code all my info.
I wrote "gay son" in green.
Green means go,

so I know to go ahead
and shut up about it.

Orange means "orange you glad
you didn't bring it up?"
Most colors mean don't say it.

-How is, uh, Tom,
the homosexual sophomore?

[ Car horn blares ]
-Time to make the doughnuts!
[ Chuckles ]
Come on.
Whoa!

No, I promise.
I won't do it again.
Come on.
[ Snorts ] I lied.
[ Laughs ]

-We got the van
at a used car lot.

We think it says "Hallelujah
Church of Scranton" in Korean.
It was either this

or an old school bus
with an owl living in it.

You didn't happen to bring
any coffee, did you, Michael?

Milk and sugar.
-Oh, awesome.
You're a life saver.

Wait, is this just
milk and sugar?

-That's what I said.
Uh...yep.

We have 20 of those.
-Oh! Oh! Excuse me!
Sorry, sorry, no.

It's, uh,
it's a paper company now.
It's not for the church.

-Over time, with enough volume,
we become profitable.

-Yeah, with the fixed cost
pricing model, that's correct,

but you need to use a variable
cost pricing model.
-Okay. Sure. Right.

So, why don't you explain what
that is so they can --

Just explain what that is.
-Explain what you think that is.

-Okay.
-Just explain that.

-As you sell more paper
and your company grows,

so will your costs --
for example, delivery man,

health care, business expansion.
-Whatever. Yeah. So --

-At these prices,
the more paper you sell,

the less money you'll make.
-Our prices are the only thing

keeping us in business.
-They're actually
putting you out of business.
-Okay. Okay. Hold on. Hold on.

Ty, I would like you to crunch
those numbers again.

-It's a program.
There's no such thing --

-Just crunch them.
Just crunch them, please.

-I can't believe
I'm about to say this, but...
the cheapest option...

is to make Michael an offer.
-Yes.

Yes, I was gonna say the same
thing. We should buy him out.

-Aw, but you didn't.
-Oh, man.
If only Michael had children.

That's how you really
apply the pressure.
-What is wrong with you?

-Hello.
-Hi.

-Michael Scott Paper Company
to see Mr. David Wallace.
I believe we were expected.
Well, well, well.
How the turntables.

-We are prepared to make you
a very generous offer.

-And we are prepared
to reject that offer.

-Michael, you haven't even h--
-Never accept their first offer.

What is your second offer?
-$12,000.
-Are you kidding me?
That is insultingly low.

I don't even what to hear what
your first offer was.
-What do you hear?
-[ Imitates muffles speaking ]

-Your company is losing clients
left and right.

You have a stockholder meeting
coming up,

and you're going to have to
explain to them
why your most profitable branch
is bleeding.

So they may be looking for
a little change in the CFO.

So I don't think I need to wait
out Dunder Mifflin.

I think I just have to
wait out you.

-Okay, now, I don't know
that I can get this.

I do have to go to the board
for approval.
How's about $60,000?
Hmm?

Michael?
-[ Stammering ]

-What?
-We're gonna have to talk.

-We're gonna have to
talk amongst ourselves.

-Okay. Please, take the room.
We are outside.
Take your time.
-Oh, my God. Oh, my God.
